intro: Lavauxia cuspidata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed lavauxia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of both ray and disc flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Lavauxia cuspidata is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to stabilize soil in harsh environments.
